chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J. Yehudah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph J. Yehudah is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph J. Yehudah was found guilty of Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Joseph J. Yehudah was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

miscConds.notes:
Bond applied  -  Balance still to be collected during probation. 
  If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges are Allowed.  
It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.


**Deft is ordered to report to the jail on 5/2/15 by 6:00 pm.  In the event, the deft cannot report by 5/2/15 due to medical reasons, he shall submit the proof to the sheriff 10 days prior to his report date. **

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVOKED  -  Consecutive to 14CF172.  -  Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

superMiscConds.notes:
ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied  Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.
